translations.english_saheeh: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Have you seen him who denies the Recompense?
translations.english_rwwad: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.107:2) Narrated Sahl bin Sa‘d رضي الله عنهما : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "I and the person who looks after an orphan and provides for him, will be in Paradise like this," putting his index and middle fingers together. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.8, Hadith No.34).

translations.english_saheeh: For that is the one who drives away the orphan
translations.english_hilali_khan: That is he who repulses the orphan (harshly),[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Such is the one who repulses the orphan harshly,

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.107:3) Narrated Abû Hurairah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The one who looks after a widow or a poor person is like a Mujâhid (fighter) who fights for Allâh’s Cause, or like him who performs prayers all the night and fasts all the day." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.7, Hadith No.265).

translations.english_saheeh: And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And urges not on the feeding of Al-Miskîn (the poor),[2]
translations.english_rwwad: and does not urge others to feed the needy.

translations.english_saheeh: So woe to those who pray
translations.english_hilali_khan: So woe unto those performers of Salât (prayers) (hypocrites),
translations.english_rwwad: So woe to those who pray,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [2000]- i.e., the hypocrites who are unconcerned if they miss prayers when no one sees them.

translations.english_saheeh: [But] who are heedless of their prayer[2000] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Those who delay their Salât (prayer from their stated fixed times).
translations.english_rwwad: but are heedless of their prayer;

translations.english_saheeh: Those who make show [of their deeds]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Those who do good deeds only to be seen (of men),
And prevent Al-Mâ‘ûn (small kindnesses like salt, sugar, water).
translations.english_rwwad: and withhold even the small kindnesses.
